title: Find Lcm Of Two Numbers By Recursion
description:
## Write a program to find lcm of two numbers by recursion

LCM (Least Common Multiple) of two numbers is the smallest number that can be divided by both numbers. For example, the LCM of 15 and 20 is 60 and LCM of 10 and 15 is 30.

```txt
Input  : 12 18
Output : 36
```

---
julia:
function main()
    println("Enter the first number:")
    num1 = parse(Int, readline())
    println("Enter the second number:")
    num2 = parse(Int, readline())

    lcm_value = lcm(num1, num2)
    println("The LCM of $num1 and $num2 is $lcm_value")
end

function gcd(a, b)
    if b == 0
        return abs(a)  # Ensure GCD is always positive
    else
        return gcd(b, a % b)
    end
end

function lcm(a, b)
    return abs(a * b) รท gcd(a, b)  # Calculate LCM using the GCD
end

php:
<?php 

function gcd($x, $y)
{
    return $x === 0 ? $y : gcd($y % $x, $x);
}

function lcm($x, $y)
{
    return ($x / gcd($x, $y)) * $y;
}

echo(lcm(12, 18));

?>
